definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: And when we buried him beneath the willow.
sentences.chinese: 当我们将他下葬合上了柳木棺盖。

sentences.english: Its crew was interred with full military honors in 2004.
sentences.chinese: 2004年，它的船员与军人的荣誉一起下葬。

sentences.english: Some believe that men who are buried alone will bring bad luck on the families for future generations.
sentences.chinese: 一些人认为单独下葬的男人会给后代带来噩运。

sentences.english: The public cemetery is for the institution the place which buries the behavior to provide.
sentences.chinese: 公墓是为制度化的下葬行为提供的场所。

sentences.english: Heathcliff makes one last visit to see her body before she is buried.
sentences.chinese: 在她下葬之前，希斯克里夫最后一次见到了她的遗体。

sentences.english: Last of New China's first generals cremated.
sentences.chinese: 中国最后一位开国上将吕正操下葬。

sentences.english: At his grave today, I cried like a baby.
sentences.chinese: 在他下葬的那天，我像个孩子一样痛哭流涕。

sentences.english: 210BC Qin Shihuangdi dies of an illness on tour. The terracotta army is buried near his tomb.
sentences.chinese: 公元前210秦始皇死于巡防途中，秦俑下葬。

sentences.english: I want to be buried with a fork in my right hand.
sentences.chinese: 我希望下葬时右手握住一把餐叉。

sentences.english: No post-mortem examination was performed, and Jobs was buried on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 乔布斯死后并未进行尸体解剖，并于上周五下葬。

sentences.english: This general was buried with full military honors.
sentences.chinese: 这位将军是以最隆重的军礼下葬。

sentences.english: There's a body to be buried, a house full of stuff to get rid of.
sentences.chinese: 遗体等著下葬，还有一屋子家什待人清理。

sentences.english: The body was interred at that cemetery.

definition: to put dead body in coffin
buried and at rest (idiom); Resquiescat in pacem (RIP)
to participate in funeral procession/to attend a burial
to keep watch beside a coffin
to wear mourning clothes/to be in mourning/also written 披麻帶孝|披麻带孝
